page.title: 11WORK IN GREENHALGH/ROSEACRE
page.content: This area has seen change in recent years. From predominantly agricultural employment, we now have a wider source of job potential. Due to improved travel facilities workers are able to commute from the rural areas quite easily. In close proximity we have B.N.F.L. of Salwick who still take quite a lot of young people for apprenticeship. B.Ae. of Warton and Preston, I.C.I. at Thornton, Guardian Royal Assurance at Lytham also provide a large proportion of the employment in the area. Seasonal jobs at Blackpool fill in for students on summer vacation. A few seasonal jobs are also available on the farms. There is a problem with unemployment for teenagers though not as bad as in some areas. Small businesses are being created by some redundant workers.
